wobani.resources.buffers

Class BufferObjectBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • wobani.resources.buffers.BufferObjectBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ssbo, Ubo

    public abstract class BufferObjectBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource
    Object oriented wrapper class above the native OpneGL Buffers.

        @Bind
public void allocateMemory(int size,
                                  boolean dynamic)
        Allocates memory for the Buffer.
        Parameters:
        size - memory size to allocate (in bytes)
        dynamic - true if the data should be dynamic, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - size must be positive

public void storeData(@NotNull

        Stores the given data on the specified position.
        Parameters:
        data - data to store
        offset - data's offset (in bytes)

      • storeData

        @Bind
public void storeData(@NotNull
                             java.nio.FloatBuffer data,
                             long offset)
        Stores the given data on the specified position.
        Parameters:
        data - data to store
        offset - data's offset (in bytes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - offset can't be lower than 0
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - didn't allocated enough memory for the data

public void storeData(@NotNull
                             java.nio.IntBuffer data,
                             long offset)
        Stores the given data on the specified position.
        Parameters:

        offset - data's offset (in bytes)

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - offset can't be lower than 0
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - didn't allocated enough memory for the data

      • bindToBindingPoint

        public void bindToBindingPoint(int bindingPoint)
        Binds the Buffer to the given binding point. You don't have to bind the Buffer before calling this method (but it's not a problem if youe do). Note that this method doesn't bind the Buffer, it binds to a binding point. If you want to bind the Buffer, you should call the bind method.
        Parameters:
        bindingPoint - binding point
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - binding point can't be lower than 0
        See Also:
        bind()

      • isUsable

        public boolean isUsable()
        Determines wheter this Buffer is usable. If it returns false, you can't use it for anything.
        Specified by:
        isUsable in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise

      • release

        public void release()
        Removes the Buffer from the VRAM. After you released the Buffer, you can't use it for anything.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Resource
